abstract: Glastonbury Music Festival has endured and grown long after Michael Eavis launched it on his dairy farm in Somerset County, England, in 1970; festival, which began with 1,500 attendees, has grown to 135,000 and is regarded by some as world's most influential music event.
lead_paragraph: Michael Eavis, the English dairy farmer who founded this vast, bucolic arts event, talks about its early days and the ingredients of its success.

headline.print_headline: Long After a Farmer’s Epiphany, Glastonbury Festival Endures

snippet: Michael Eavis, the English dairy farmer who founded this vast, bucolic arts event, talks about its early days and the ingredients of its success.

keywords.value: Glastonbury Festival of Contemporary Performing Arts
